reviews.title: First visit to Amsterdam
reviews.text: Lovely room. Ignored the renovation work as was going to be out all day. Staff brilliant & friendly. The size of the room was not important, as it was only used for sleeping & showering, in the bathroom. A chair would be useful for longer than one night stays. Definately stay there again, but when the renovation work is completed, I doubt if the single room cost will be 40GBP.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the reviews I was a little concerned about the hotel before arriving. I should have listened to my instincts! It looks closed from the outside, the scaffolding has gone, but the building is still filthy and massively knocked about.
reviews.title: only if you're desperate!!

likes.disliked: — very small room, noisy building work

reviews.text: There are dustsheets everywhere covering the interior, paper over a new marble floor in the foyer, generally a very poor first impression. The staff seem pleasant, although take proof of your booking, we were told that breakfast wasn't included for expedia guests, luckily our confirmation email said that it did. You do need to go along the road to a different hotel for excellent buffet style breakfast.
reviews.title: Artful Deception

reviews.text: We were given one of the refurbished rooms, just as pictured on the website, but perhaps using trick photography!! Quite possibly the smallest double room I've ever been in, you are able to walk round the bed, but there was only about a foot to spare at the bottom. No bedside cabinets or lamps, but the most inappropriately large desk you've ever seen, no chair though!
reviews.title: Worst "Hotel" Ever
Worst hotel I have ever been to
reviews.text: The ensuite was very nice, everything you need, but very snug with a glass door into the bedroom.

I read the bad reviews but was desperate for a room on the busiest weekend in Amsterdam. I knew about the construction, but the entire hotel is torn apart. The signs in the hotel promised 9-6 p.m. construction, but I was jolted out of bed at 7 a.m. to the sound of jackhammering and sawing. My entire room was filled with dust. My room had untreated drywall for walls, mold on the bathroom walls, and no telephone (all this in a room that was over 150 euros per night). Yes, the location is ideal, but this hotel should be closed during construction--it is really not professional to have guests there, but especiall not for the price. I checked out and was able to find something better for half the price.
reviews.title: Tthe Worst Hotel I've ever Experienced
